meanings.definition: A dull, heavy sound, such as that made by a heavy object falling or striking something.
meanings.sent1: The thudding of the hammer echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: I heard the thudding of footsteps approaching slowly.
meanings.sent3: The thudding of the drum was so loud, it made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The thudding of my heart drowned out all other noises.
meanings.sent5: The thudding of the bass in the music was so powerful, it vibrated the floor.

meanings.definition: The act of making a dull, heavy sound.
meanings.sent1: Her thudding on the door startled me.
meanings.sent2: The thudding of the rain on the roof was soothing.
meanings.sent3: The thudding of the basketball hitting the ground was oddly rhythmic.
meanings.sent4: The thudding of the falling tree branches signaled the storm's arrival.
meanings.sent5: The thudding of the old clock in the hallway was a constant reminder of time passing.
